subject: Negotiation
title: The OPEC Oil Embargo of 1973
description: Learn The OPEC Oil Embargo of 1973 in one minute.

hook.text: Arab oil producers turned off the taps in 1973 and brought the Western world to its knees.

buildup.text: OPEC nations embargoed oil exports to the US and Europe over support for Israel.

discovery.text: Oil prices quadrupled in months, causing gas lines, recessions, and panic across the West.

twist.text: The embargo proved that resource control was the ultimate negotiation leverage in geopolitics.

climax.text: It permanently changed energy policy and forced diversification away from Middle Eastern oil.

punchline.text: Control the resource, control the negotiation.

quiz.question: What negotiation lesson did the 1973 oil embargo teach?
options: Oil is the only important resource
Control of a critical resource gives enormous negotiation leverage
